name: Fix rolling_groupby and expanding_groupby for pandas 1.3.0
Enable Windows support and by default set the number of workers equals to the number of physical cores
Fix issue #174: Not able to turn off progress bars
Enable Widget progress bars in Google Colab
Enable Python 3.10, deactivate inliner and massive refactor
Implement `df.groupby(args1).col_name.expanding(args2).parallel_apply(func)` and fix Python3.8 on macOS
Handle small datasets with Memory File System
Fix memory leak & console progress bar issue if an exception is raised
Add tip if OSError when Memory File System is used
Complete refactor
body:
- Remove `pyarrow plasma` dependancy
- Progress bars is not any more an experimental feature
- Implement progress bars for all type of computation
- Implement transfer with Memory File System if available
- Complete refactor of code

name: Series.parallel_map & DataFrameGroupBy.parallel_apply improved
body:
**Series.parallel_map:**
* Can take all arguments `map` takes
* Implement progress bar

**DataFrameGroupBy.parallel_apply**
* Return type is the same as `apply` return type

name: DataFrame.parallel_apply: Complet & Implement progress bar
body:
For `DataFrame.parallel_apply`:
- Now can take all possible arguments of `DataFrame.apply`
- Implement progress bar (WARNING: Experimental feature)

name: pip install now installs all needed dependencies
